Detailed Description

Obsolete - use MultiLineEditor or LineEditor from Gui instead.

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef AbstractEditBox EditBox::Base
 

Reimplemented from AbstractEditBox.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum EditBox::DeleteMode
 

Enumerator:
DelLeftCharMode  Pressing on the delete-key results in a deleting the character left from the cursor and moving the cursor left one character.
DelCurrCharMode  Pressing on the delete-key results in deleting the character below the cursor.

enum EditBox::EditMode
 

Enumerator:
AlphanumMode  All characters are possible for input.
AlphanumNameMode  AlphanumMode with automatic upper-case letters after a space character.
NumericMode  Characters from 0 to 9 allowed.
PhoneNumberMode  Characters from 0 to 9, #, + and ? allowed.
PredInputMode 

enum EditBox::ShiftState
 

Enumerator:
OffShiftstate 
OnShiftstate 
LockedShiftstate 

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

EditBox::EditBox (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

EditBox::EditBox (  Control *  parent,
WCHAR *  text = 0,
INT  max_text_len = 0,
EditMode  edit_mode = AlphanumMode,
const WCHAR *  caption = 0,
CaptionPos  caption_pos = CaptionOnTop
) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer the window, which embedds the editor.
text Pointer to the text to edit.
max_text_len Maximal length of the text to edit (Attention: include the terminal zero).
edit_mode See EditMode.
caption Pointer to the caption.
caption_pos See CaptionPosType.

void EditBox::OnDtmfSeparator (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the key for the DTMF separator has been pressed for a long time. The character can be defined in EditConfig.

void EditBox::OnWildcard (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is called, if the key for the wildcard character has been pressed for a long time. The character can be defined in EditConfig.
